title.narrative: Ensuring Life-saving Gender-based Violence Assistance to Women and Girls in Drought-Affected Regions of Namibia

description.narrative: The main aim of UNFPA’s protection project is to ensure life-saving assistance to women and young people who have suffered or are at risk of gender-based violence in drought-affected regions of Namibia. UNFPA will establish 6 referral pathways for GBV and run 12 information sessions for the prevention of sexual abuse and exploitation, equip 6 health facilities with kits to enable clinical management of rape, procure dignity kits for 6,000 women and girls, including 355 disabled women and girls and 300 people living with HIV/AIDS, and conduct 100 community awareness raising sessions on the prevention, mitigation and treatment of GBV.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Ensuring Life-saving Gender-based Violence Assistance to Women and Girls in Drought-Affected Regions of Namibia

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS NAMIBIA RAPID RESPONSE DROUGHT 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: 200 Community Awareness Raising sessions on the prevention, mitigation and treatment of GBV through health extension workers and community policing volunteers (Women & Men Network) to ensure that all survivors of GBV know how to seek care at health facilities and are linked to psychosocial support (PSS) and protection services
Number of women and girls reached with GBV awareness raising messages, availability of GBV lifesaving services
Number of community awareness raising sessions conducted in targeted regions targeting 250 participants per session.

Distribution of 6,000 dignity kits to the most vulnerable women and girls, based on their needs. The kits will target women and girls of reproductive age, with special attention giving to People Living with Disabilities and People Living with HIV/AIDS
Number of persons living with HIV/AIDS who receive dignity kits
Number of persons living with disabilities who receive dignity kits
Number of women and girls who receive dignity kits, disaggregated by age and disability status

Increased access to clinical management of rape survivors (CMR) services by equipping health facilities with medical commodities, protocols and orientation of health care workers to treat survivors of sexual violence
Number of service delivery points offering CMR and SRH services (including one stop center, mobile/outreach facilities) in the six regions
Proportion of female survivors that have reported to the health facility within 120 hours to receive emergency contraceptive (EC) services
Proportion of reported rape survivors that benefitted from post-rape treatment within 72 hours after the incident

Increased access to survivor-centered GBV prevention and response services, with a focus on linkages to comprehensive medical, psychosocial care and protection, through strengthening of the GBV referral system
Number of GBV Referral Pathways established and strengthened to provide safe, accessible survivor-centered life-saving services
Number of PSEA awareness information sessions conducted for government and civil society partners including community volunteers
Number of community members, aid workers and volunteers reached with PSEA messages
